comments:
Build ID: WTP 1.5.3

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Click Publish in Server view while running under SUN Linux JDK 1.5.0_10.


Maybe this isn't a bug, maybe this is a change to the way SUN JDK works.


More information:
SUN JDK 1.5.0_08 works ok.

java.lang.InternalError
        at java.util.zip.Deflater.init(Native Method)
        at java.util.zip.Deflater.<init>(Deflater.java:117)
        at java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream.<init>(ZipOutputStream.java:61)
        at org.eclipse.jst.server.core.PublishUtil.publishZip(PublishUtil.java:630)
        at org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.core.internal.PublishOperation2.publishJar(PublishOperation2.java:109)
        at org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.core.internal.PublishOperation2.execute(PublishOperation2.java:51)
        at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.performTasks(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:806)
        at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publish(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:591)
        at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.doPublish(Server.java:862)
        at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.publish(Server.java:850)
        at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.PublishServerJob.run(PublishServerJob.java:142)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I've double-checked the WTP code, and I see no errors nor effect it could possibly have on this. The failure is when trying to load the Deflater class (used when zipping and unzipping in Java) and happens in native code, called from within the Java class library by ZipOutputStream.

This appears to be a Sun JDK 1.5.0_10 bug, so I suggest you open a bug against them for this. You might be able to reproduce this just by making the same call as ZipOutputStream from within a Java main() app:
  new Deflater(Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION, true)
Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.
